Let lFitX be the local Fitting class generated by a set of groups X and let Ψ(G) be the smallest normal subgroup of a finite group G such that lFit(Ψ(G)∩M) = lFitM for every M◁◁G (K. Doerk, P. Hauck, Arch. Math., 35, no. 3 (1980), 218–227). We say that a Fitting class F is saturated if Ψ(G) ∈F implies that G ∈F. Is it true that every non-empty soluble saturated Fitting class is local?
N. T. Vorob’¨ev
